alert.note: Alert for Edgecombe; Franklin; Halifax; Nash; Warren (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 3:47PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Warren, Nash, northwestern Edgecombe, Halifax and Franklin Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 345 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking several thunderstorms near Bunn, Louisburg, and Warrenton that were moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rocky Mount, Roanoke Rapids, Nashville, Louisburg, Warrenton, Halifax, Norlina, Dortches, Littleton and Bunn. This includes Interstate 95 near Mile Marker 78, near Mile Marker 79, near Mile Marker 80, near Mile Marker 81, near Mile Marker 82, near Mile Marker 83, and between Mile Markers 134 and 173. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
